metadata.description: Cultural and religious content from Easy Kikuyu Facebook lessons by Emmanuel Kariuki - Batch 001 (Quran translation)

entries.english: In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful
entries.kikuyu: Na rĩtwa rĩa Ngai, mũtana, ũrĩ tha nyingĩ
entries.context: Translation of the opening verse (Bismillah) from Surah Al-Fatiha, the first chapter of the Quran
entries.cultural_notes: This translation shows the integration of Islamic faith within Kikuyu-speaking communities and demonstrates advanced religious vocabulary. The complete Fatiha translation demonstrates how Arabic religious concepts are expressed in Kikuyu.

examples.english: Master of the Day of Judgment
examples.kikuyu: Mwathani wa mũthenya wa gũtua ciira

examples.english: Guide us on the Straight Path
examples.context: Verse 6 of Fatiha - supplication for guidance

grammatical_info.religious_terms: Ngai (God), mwathani (master/lord), tha (mercy), gũtua ciira (to judge), njĩra nyoroku (straight path)

source.attribution: Emmanuel Kariuki - Easy Kikuyu lessons (Quran Fatiha translation)
